justification: The Measures section states: “Beck Depression Inventory-II (BDI-II) – a 12-item self-report questionnaire that examines depressive symptomatology over the prior 2 weeks.”
The article notes that the STAI "differentiates between the temporary condition of 'state anxiety' and the more general and long-standing quality of 'trait anxiety.'"
Under STAI the text explains that "State anxiety is characterized by feelings of apprehension, tension, nervousness, and worry," and is assessed with the STAI state items.
The NEO-FFI is described as producing scores for "extraversion, neuroticism, openness, conscientiousness, and agreeableness" from 60 self-report items.
The CD-RISC-10 is introduced as “a self-report index of resilience based on Likert-scale ratings of coping responses during the prior month.”
The DS-R is described as “a 27-item self-report questionnaire that measures an individual's sensitivity to disgust.”
The NIH Toolbox section lists a “Loneliness” instrument of 5 items yielding T-scores normed to the general population.
The same NIH Toolbox entry notes an 8-item “Emotional Support” index assessing how often an individual had access to emotional support.
The PSS is described as “a ten-item self-response questionnaire that measures the extent to which a participant perceives personal life events … as stressful.”

measured_by: Post-traumatic Stress Disorder Checklist for DSM-5 (PCL-5)
justification: The Measures list states that the PCL-5 "asks about the degree to which 20 post-traumatic stress disorder symptoms were experienced during the prior month."
The VSA is introduced as “a six-item self-report questionnaire that assesses right-wing authoritarianism.”
The article specifies “Social Dominance Orientation – a 16-item self-report index of preference for social inequality vs. hierarchy attenuation.”
The Tasks section says the BIAT “assesses implicit associations … evaluative (GOOD/BAD words) and White/Black faces … and White/Asian faces.”
The Pro-social IAT is described as assessing “implicit associations between self-identity (ME/THEY) and prosociality (SERVICE/PROFIT).”
The Public Goods Game is noted as “a standard task … that assesses the tension between self-interest and group cohesion in an anonymous group fund-sharing scenario.”
The Altruism Task has participants “make monetary decisions to distribute money equally or unequally (generous/selfish) amongst themselves and partners,” thus operationalising altruistic choice.
The SEE is presented as “a 32-item, self-report measure of how strongly one empathizes with people of other racial and ethnic backgrounds.”
The Measures list describes this as “a self-report measure of how frequently one experiences 9 types of discrimination in day-to-day life.”
The EPII is defined as a 92-item instrument “used to identify how the current pandemic has impacted various aspects of one's life.”

measured_by: External/Internal Motivation to Respond without Prejudice Scale (EMS/IMS)
justification: The EMS/IMS is said to “assess the degree to which an individual's attitudes and prejudice toward a designated racial group are motivated by internal values or external social pressures.”
